text: USB-C (USB Type-C) is a 24-pin USB connector. This type of USB connector is commonly found on smartphones and computers. The USB-C specifications were first published and finalized in August of 2014, roughly the same time as USB 3.1 specifications. It is both smaller and faster than USB-A. The USB-C 3.1 has the potential to have higher data transfer speeds. It can also deliver 100 watts of power over a single cable (this is done by upping the voltage to 20 volts). == References == Category:USB
title: USB-C
